column4: im just excited to see something debian-based with current security patches and a nice release cycle!

Each driver needs to be available for kernel 2.6, since we will only support a bare-bones 2.4 as a fallback for conservative server-oriented users (as discussed on the mailing list already). .. so is there a 2.4 pkg or not? :)
it will not change much in the next few hours
i'm assuming it wont matter much cause right after i install im gonna apt-get upgrade the system :)
after 4.10 is released, is there going to be any repository similar to testing on debian that tracks newer packages for those of us on desktops that want the newest stuff?
the next release (hoary) will open up as a sid-style branch
if you're building a kernel module, it wants linux-kernel-$(uname -r)
i installed linux-686 isnt it in there?
an apt-cache search for 'linux-kernel' only shows linux-kernel-headers
keeps beating me to it lol.. im on dvorak so typing a lil slow since i havent used it since i learned it years ago till lately :)
